metadata.Title: CVE-2023-4527 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - medium
metadata.Description:
A flaw was found in glibc. When the getaddrinfo function is called with theAF_UNSPEC address family and the system is configured with no-aaaa mode via/etc/resolv.conf, a DNS response via TCP larger than 2048 bytes canpotentially disclose stack contents through the function returned addressdata, and may cause a crash.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-4527` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

glibc-source - 2.37-0ubuntu2.1
libc-bin - 2.37-0ubuntu2.1
libc6 - 2.37-0ubuntu2.1
libc6-amd64 - 2.37-0ubuntu2.1
libc6-i386 - 2.37-0ubuntu2.1
libc6-prof - 2.37-0ubuntu2.1
libc6-s390 - 2.37-0ubuntu2.1
libc6-x32 - 2.37-0ubuntu2.1
locales - 2.37-0ubuntu2.1
locales-all - 2.37-0ubuntu2.1
nscd - 2.37-0ubuntu2.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: glibc package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.37-0ubuntu2.1').
